parts.name: GM LS V8 Swap (Nissan S-Chassis)
parts.description: The 'LS-S' swap. Dropping a GM LS1/LS2/LS3 or truck motor (LM7/LQ4/LQ9) into a Nissan 240SX. Offers massive torque and reliability compared to the SR20DET.
specs: Requires swap kit (Mounts, Oil Pan, Headers)
T56 or CD009 Transmission adapter needed

models.name: 240SX (S13)
models.notes: Most popular drift chassis for LS swap

parts.name: Honda K24 Swap (Mazda Miata)
parts.description: The 'K-Miata' swap. Replacing the aging Mazda B6/BP engine with a high-revving Honda K24. Doubles the horsepower while keeping the car naturally aspirated and lightweight.
specs: Requires adapter plate for Miata transmission OR BMW ZF transmission

parts.name: GM LS V8 Swap (BMW E36)
parts.description: The 'E36 LS'. Fits surprisingly well in the E36 engine bay. Excellent weight distribution and parts availability.
specs: Requires custom headers (tight steering shaft clearance)
CAN bus integration not needed for E36 (simpler electronics)

parts.name: Ford 5.0L Coyote Swap (Fox Body)
parts.description: Modern power in a classic chassis. The DOHC Coyote engine is physically large but fits in a Fox Body with the right K-member.
specs: Requires tubular K-member (stock one won't clear oil pan/headers)
Hydroboost brake conversion often needed (vacuum booster is too big)

parts.name: Honda K20/K24 Swap (Toyota MR2 Spyder)
parts.description: Fixing the one flaw of the MR2 Spyder (the weak 1ZZ engine). A K20 or K24 turns this chassis into a Lotus Elise killer.
specs: Stock Toyota transmission cannot be used (use Honda 6-speed)

parts.name: 2JZ-GTE Swap (Lexus IS300)
parts.description: The IS300 came with the non-turbo 2JZ-GE. Swapping in the turbo 2JZ-GTE (from an Aristo or Supra) is the natural evolution.
specs: Stock W55 transmission is weak (upgrade to R154 or CD009 recommended)
